objSummary: more side effects and serious adverse events
ref: Patients with anxious depression experienced a greater frequency, intensity, and burden of side effects, as well as more serious adverse events during citalopram treatment.

obj: major depressive disorder but with differentiated effectiveness in anxious vs nonanxious depression
ref: Citalopram treats major depressive disorder, showing differentiated effectiveness in anxious versus nonanxious depression.

obj: nonanxious depression
ref: Anxious depression is significantly more common than nonanxious depression among African Americans than in other racial/ethnic groups; among Hispanics than non-Hispanics; among those seen in primary care settings than those in psychiatric care settings; among those who are unemployed than those who are employed; among those who are married, divorced, or widowed than among those who had never married; and among those with less education, those with public insurance, and those with lower income.

obj: unemployment, low education, public insurance, lower income, severe depression, greater perceived physical impairment, diminished quality of life, later onset of major depression, more concurrent anxiety disorders, more melancholic/endogenous features, more medical comorbidity
ref: Anxious depression is associated with unemployment, low education, public insurance, lower income, severe depression, greater perceived physical impairment, diminished quality of life, later onset of major depression, more concurrent anxiety disorders, melancholic/endogenous features, and more medical comorbidity.

obj: citalopram treatment compared to those with nonanxious depression
ref: Anxious depression is less likely to respond or to remit with citalopram treatment compared to those with nonanxious depression.

obj: greater side effect frequency, intensity, burden, and more serious adverse events compared to nonanxious depression
ref: Despite similar citalopram dosages in both groups, anxious depression is associated with greater side effect frequency, intensity, burden, and more serious adverse events, including psychiatric nature, compared to nonanxious depression.

obj: Major depressive disorder in the STAR*D Level 1 treatment
ref: Citalopram was used as the first-line treatment for major depressive disorder in the Sequenced Treatment Alternatives to Relieve Depression (STAR*D) Level 1 treatment.

obj: Anxious depression taking longer to remit with treatment than nonanxious depression
ref: Those with nonanxious depression achieve remission and response sooner on average than those with anxious depression.

obj: low socioeconomic status, great severity of depression, late onset of depression, high physical illness burden, and significant clinical and sociodemographic differences
ref: Anxious depression is associated with low socioeconomic status, great severity of depression, late onset of depression, high physical illness burden, and significant clinical and sociodemographic differences.
